compare_subtitle: Compare weather quality between two cities
error_loading: Error loading forecast. Please try again.
about_subtitle: Understanding Our Weather Quality Prediction System
api_docs_subtitle: Integrate Weather Quality predictions into your applications
overview_text: Our Weather Quality Index (WQI) is an AI-powered system that predicts how pleasant and comfortable the weather will be for outdoor activities. Unlike traditional weather forecasts that only show temperature and conditions, our system evaluates multiple factors to give you a comprehensive quality score from 0 to 100.
key_innovation_text: We use a deep learning neural network trained on historical weather data to predict weather quality, not just weather conditions. This allows us to provide actionable insights for planning your activities.
input_parameters_text: Our AI model analyzes three primary weather parameters:
humidity_param: Relative Humidity (%): Moisture level in the air
cloud_cover_param: Cloud Cover (0-8 scale): Sky coverage converted from percentage
ai_model_text: We use a deep neural network (TensorFlow/Keras) that has been trained on thousands of historical weather data points. The model learns complex patterns and relationships between weather parameters and human comfort levels.
ideal_temperature_text: 18-26°C is generally most comfortable for outdoor activities
clear_skies_text: Low cloud cover (0-2 on our scale) provides pleasant conditions
note_text: The model considers all factors together. For example, a slightly higher temperature can still score well if humidity is low and skies are clear. The AI learns these complex relationships from real-world data.
ai_explainability_text: Our system provides "Explainable AI" insights that tell you exactly why a day received its quality score. For example:
ai_example1: "Excellent conditions! Ideal Temperature, Clear Skies contributing to a high score."
ai_example2: "Score lowered by: Very Hot (32°C), High Humidity (85%)."
ai_explainability_text2: This transparency helps you understand not just the score, but what factors are influencing it.
data_sources_text: We use reliable, open-source weather data:
open_meteo: Open-Meteo API: For current and forecasted weather data
open_meteo_archive: Open-Meteo Archive: For historical climate trends
geocoding_api: Geocoding API: For accurate city location data
data_sources_text2: All data is updated in real-time, ensuring you get the most current and accurate forecasts available.
activity_recommendations_text: Our system automatically identifies the best days for specific activities based on weather quality:
activity_recommendations_text2: If no suitable day is found in the 14-day forecast, we suggest "Maybe next week?" to set realistic expectations.
faq_why_not_temp_text: Temperature alone doesn't tell the full story. A 25°C day with 90% humidity feels very different from a 25°C day with 30% humidity. Our AI model accounts for these interactions.
faq_accuracy_text: Our quality predictions are based on the same weather data used by major weather services. The AI model has been trained on historical patterns, making it highly reliable for short-term forecasts (1-3 days) and reasonably accurate for longer periods (up to 14 days).
faq_events: Can I use this for planning events?
faq_events_text: Absolutely! Our 14-day forecast with activity recommendations is perfect for planning outdoor events, trips, or activities. We recommend checking the forecast a few days before your event for the most accurate predictions.
base_url_text: All API endpoints are available at:
get_forecast_text: Get weather quality forecast for a specific city.
get_other_cities_text: Get today's weather quality for default cities (cached for 10 minutes).
get_historical_data_text: Get historical temperature trends for the last 5 years.
cache_control: Cache-Control: Public caching with appropriate max-age
not_modified: 304 Not Modified: Returned when content unchanged
cache_duration: Cache duration: 5-10 minutes depending on endpoint.
error_handling_text: All endpoints return standard HTTP status codes:
